snippet: Mr. Grimm, the Republican incumbent, fended off Domenic M. Recchia Jr., who focused on his rival’s legal troubles from a federal indictment related to his career before politics.
abstract: Voters in 11th Congressional District re-elect Rep Michael G Grimm of Staten Island, two-term Republican under federal indictment on fraud charges, over Democrat Domenic M Recchia Jr; Grimm remains the only Republican in New York City's congressional delegation.

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer, Jason Grant and Tatiana Schlossberg contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Grimm, the Republican incumbent, fended off Domenic M. Recchia Jr., who focused on his rival’s legal troubles from a federal indictment related to his career before politics.

headline.main: Michael Grimm Overcomes Democrats’ Campaign to Capture His Congressional Seat
headline.print_headline: Grimm Beats Back Democrats’ Campaign to Capture His Congressional Seat
